alert.note: Alert for Campbell; Kenton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 08 at 4:42PM EDT until June 08 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL KENTON...CENTRAL CAMPBELL...SOUTHEASTERN HAMILTON AND NORTHWESTERN CLERMONT COUNTIES... At 442 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Taylor Mill, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Covington, Independence, Erlanger, Fort Thomas, Newport, Edgewood, Alexandria, Elsmere, Fort Mitchell, Highland Heights, Milford, Taylor Mill, Fort Wright, Southgate, Crescent Springs, Crestview Hills, Park Hills, Lakeside Park and Claryville. This includes I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 184 and 190. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
